message: So, we need to get organised
more than anything, we need a direction
so that we can actually individually work on independent modules to get a nice product together
I sound like a douche, hahaha
but its true
I think the worst thing we could do is just start doing random things independently, which would basically defeat the purpose of the project

One commit pushed to branch gui by Adam Thalhammer in chocvanilla/weather-app
- added basic gui with search box and list of weather stations and fa... · e5d500b

agreed with everything you said. so to the process going I expanded on the work we did yesterday by adding a searchable list of weather stations. pull and try it out (run WeatherApp.main). If everyone is happy we can move forward and build on this (e.g. add action listeners to the buttons, opening a new window with a chart).
okay cool cool, just had a look actually
great framework so far
ill start playing around with the charting tool, so that eventually a button click calls a method, which takes the station as a parameter and charts the past temps form that
i wont make the button, and ill try my best to stick to the chart package and work with the infrastructure we alreayd have
sounds good. I am at work all day but happy to help out tonight. cheers
no problem at all, thanks heaps for all the work you've already done :).
I personally suggest celebratory beers once this is handed in
Just pulled the gui branch
Really like the way the search behaves!
ive benn gone a bit, ill be continuing some work after dinner, and some alcohol :p
So i've put together an incredibly rough start to charting. It may or may not throw an exception here or there, and for some odd reason it doesnt even chart them in order
So i'll commit it for nw incase you guys wish to have a look
also, Kyle and I have a large break from 12:30-4:30 tomorrow, so if you guys are around, we'll most probably be in building 14 on level 11, working on the assignment :)

nice work @Rhys loving the charts. so artistic
kidding aside, I think it's a great start. our app does something! see you at uni tomorrow guys
